text:
'-' in value of Path field of an HTTP Request controller following an HTTP HTML 
Link Parser causes '.*' to be produced for request parameter values that are 
expected to be randomly selected from the parse results.

Cannot verify in nightly build version of JMeter > 1.7.2. See note at end for 
explanation.

Test Plan
  Thread Group (threads 1, count 1)
    HTTP Request Defaults
    HTTP Cookie Manager
    HTTP Header Manager (User-Agent string set to a requisite value)
    Simple Controller
      HTTP Request (irrelevant, traverse the central index page in our app)
      Loop Controller (count 3)
        HTTP Request (produce sample with several <a href="path1?id=val">
                      the 'id' values are unique ids for categories)
mcA     Modification Controller
lpA       HTTP HTML Link Parser
          HTTP Request (parameter 'id' with value '.*' specified, WORKS FINE,
                        produce sample with <a href="path2?list=val&sel=val">.
                        Each <a> is for one item from the category with 'id',
                        above.
                        'list' is a comma separated list of ALL 'sel' values.
                        'sel'  is specific,unique value for the item itself.)
mcB   Modification Controller (uses the result of the last iteration of Loop)
lpB     HTTP HTML Link Parser
brq     HTTP Request (parameters 'list' and 'sel' specified, both as '.*')

I have tagged some elements of interest with TLAs.

All parameter values in href's in the responses driving the test are strings of 
digits only, or a comma separated list of digits strings as noted above.

OK, the test plan goes via a central index page to a data driven list page.

We simulate the end user browsing around the list and viewing subsidiary lists 
(also data driven) with the Loop Controller.

Modification Controller 'mcB' and Link Parser 'lpB' use the last sample from 
the last iteration of the Loop Controller. The end user is going to make a 
choice from the most recently viewed subsidiary list.

HTTP Request 'brq' in Modification Controller 'mcB' works fine as long as there 
is no '-' character in the value of its Path field.

Our app at that point does browser detection in '/path3/feature.html' and goes 
to a browser specific page if necessary, passing parameters through. Our naming 
convention for the specific pages is '/path3/feature-browserfamily.html'.

If HTTP Request 'brq' has Path field value '/path3/feature.html', the test plan 
works and random parameter values from the Link Parser are used to create a 
query string and produce '/path3/feature.html?list=listvalue&sel=selvalue'.

If HTTP Request 'brq' has Path field value '/path3/feature-
familyname.html', '.*' is used as the values for both 'list' and 'sel'. This 
name with a '-' is the more critical page for our test to visit.

If Modification Manager of 1.7 has been folded into other class/es of latest 
source tree, this problem may still exist in nightly builds.

[Nightly builds I download, rebuild and try have all had various problems for 
the past week or two. Do not [yet] have access to port 2401 for anonymous CVS 
access from behind our firewall.]
creator: johnk@nstc.nec.com.au

text:
This is probably already fixed in the latest JMeter code.  I'm not sure what you
mean by "various problems" in the nightlies.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
I'm going to assume this isn't a problem in JMeter 1.7.3 and later.  Please
re-open if it is.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
johnk@nstc.nec.com.au
text:
Ported the test plan from v1.7 to CVS codebase 2002-08-21 02:15 UTC/GMT.
The problem still occurs.

The revised Test Plan structure is:

Test Plan
  Thread Group (threads 1, ramp up 1, count 1)
    HTTP Header Manager (User-Agent string set to a requisite value)
    HTTP Cookie Manager
    HTTP Request Defaults (IP set, port set, HTTP, GET, follow ON, keepalive ON)
    Simple Controller
      Loop Controller (count 3)
        HTTP Request (produce sample with several <a href="path1?id=val">
                      the 'id' values are unique ids for categories)
lpA     HTTP HTML Link Parser
        HTTP Request (parameter 'id' with value '.*' specified, WORKS FINE,
                      produce sample with <a href="path2?list=val&sel=val">.
                      Each <a> is for one item from the category with 'id',
                      from above.
                      'list' is a comma separated list of ALL 'sel' values.
                      'sel'  is specific,unique value for the item itself.)
lpB   HTTP HTML Link Parser
brq   HTTP Request (parameters 'list' and 'sel' specified, both as '.*')

Behaviour for HTTP Request 'brq' from the original submission still occurs.

Platform information! The original submission was for:
JMeter v1.7
compile j2sdk1.4.0_01 64 bit (ie bin/sparcv9/java used to run ANT)
        on Platform SUN with OS Solaris 8 
runtime j2sdk1.4.0_01
        on Platform PC with OS WinNT

The reopen is for:
JMeter v1.7.3 and CVS HEAD at 2002 08 21 02:15 UTC
Platform SUN
OS Solaris 8
compile j2sdk1.4.0_01 32 bit (ie bin/java used to run ANT)
runtime j2sdk1.4.0_01 32 bit
creator: johnk@nstc.nec.com.au
johnk@nstc.nec.com.au
text:
Bug resides between my keyboard and my seat. There was never a problem with any 
version of JMeter for the task I was trying to perform, only in my 
understanding of HTML Link Parser.

My test plan itself is broken at HTTP Request 'brq'. It is broken because its 
Path value is not equal to any link/path detected/assembled by HTML Link 
Parser. 

Hence, .* appears in the HTTP Request following the HTML Link Parser. JMeter is 
not substituting 'random' values for .* because it is not supposed to. The Path 
of the HTTP Request must MATCH on of the paths from the results of the HTML 
Link Parser.

I laboured under the assumption that the parameter names simply had to match 
between (results of the HTML Link Parser) and (HTTP Request immediately 
following HTML Link Parser). This is obviously to simple.

Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
